meanings.definition: To give strength or vigor to
meanings.sent1: Exercising regularly can nervate your muscles and make you feel stronger.
meanings.sent2: A good night's sleep can nervate you for the challenges of the next day.
meanings.sent3: Drinking a cup of coffee in the morning nervates me and helps me wake up.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speech nervated the team, making them ready for the game.
meanings.sent5: The fresh air and sunshine nervated her spirit, lifting her mood instantly.

meanings.sent1: Listening to upbeat music can nervate you and boost your energy levels.
meanings.sent2: A brisk walk in the park can nervate your body and mind.
meanings.sent3: The smell of freshly baked cookies nervated the children, making them excited.
meanings.sent4: The inspiring story nervated her determination to pursue her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The cool breeze nervated his senses, awakening him to the beauty of nature.
